topic.title: Creating a database cluster from the command line

body.p: This topic describes how to create a database cluster from the command line.

ol.li: Log in to the installer node for your Helion OpenStack environment and source the service.osrc file: . service.osrc

Use the trove cluster-create command to create the new database. The syntax is as follows: trove cluster-create <name> <datastore> <datastore_version> [--instance <flavor=flavor_name_or_id,volume=volume>]
To view the valid datastore values, use trove datastore-list.
To view the valid datastore_version values, use trove datastore-version-list <datastore>, where datastore is the name of the datastore (e.g. mysql.)
MongoDB instances require a minimum volume size of 5.
To verify that the cluster was created, use the trove cluster-list command.
To list the instances that are part of a cluster, use the trove cluster-list <clutster name> command.

ul.li: Example 1: Create a MySql cluster called MyCluster with three database instances of flavor m1.medium and volume size 3 trove cluster-create MyCluster mysql-cluster 5.5 --instance flavor=3,volume=3 --instance flavor=3,volume=3 --instance flavor=3,volume=3

Example 2: Create a Redis cluster called MyRedisCluster with two database instances of flavor m1.small and volume size 4 trove cluster-create MyRedisCluster redis 3.0 --instance flavor=2,volume=4 --instance flavor=2,volume=4

Example 3: Create a MongoDB cluster called MyMongoDBCluster with three database instances of flavor m1.large and volume size 2 trove cluster-create MyMongoDBCluster mongodb 3.0 --instance flavor=4,volume=5 --instance flavor=4,volume=5 --instance flavor=4,volume=5
